Articles.Content:
I was just having a play in the SPH and found that I can't build this.  I want to mount the tri-wing probe on the trolley, so when it reaches takeoff speed I can separate from the trolley and fly away...  I've done similar before, but I used the "SelectRoot" mod, which doesn't seem to be available any more.  I can't get it to work with the stock re-root function.

A couple of pics of the trolley and the aircraft:

It actually flies quite nicely for a thrown-together mess.  Note the front fuel tank is empty for balance, not sure how it will fly as the fuel runs out...

Just for fun, I know there are much easier ways to launch a probe core.

Have you tried re-building the trolley? When I built mine, I just built it in order, like any other rocket - mini probe jet first, then built the trolley off of it.

OR! Is the issue the decoupler? Have you tried putting the decoupler on the other side, the jet probe?

You can't make a radial decoupler a root part.

I think what I'd do is use cubic octags on both parts, and join with a stack separator.
And the precise problem is that you can't get them to stick together? I think it's doable, but you may need to do it in the VAB. (BTW, I agree that the decoupler should be on the probe.)

Sorry for the slow reply, I think my notifications are off.

Yes, I was unable to stick the two vehicles together, but @cantab jogged my memory by mentioning cubic octagonals so now I've got a proof of concept.  I wanted the decoupler on the trolley so as to leave as much behind as possible, but it did not work - even using "Control from here" on the fliers' probe core, focus switches to the trolley on separation.  You need the decoupler on the probe, and a cubic octagonal on the decoupler.  Make the cube Root, then you can attach the probe to the trolley.  I used the Offset tool to hide the cubic inside an octagonal.

I've been able to launch the thing, but no real flight as yet, the trolley starts to wobble a lot before the probe has enough speed to launch.

 

Edited June 1, 2016 by Matt77
Set the friction to zero on all the wheels to help with wobbling.

32 minutes ago, bewing said:

Set the friction to zero on all the wheels to help with wobbling.

That worked, thankyou.  It felt a bit cheaty but I got a nice clean launch even from the dirt runway.  But now I know how to build it I can redesign something more practical...  or not!
